ratings.comment: Man, this dude is crazy.  I thought he retired, but I guess not.  If you ask him a question, he responds: "go ask a TA." He's one of the most eccentric professors I've had here at Madison, and I had him my first semester.  I even wrote a scholarship essay based on one of his quotes. Who wouldn't like a guy that asks for a cig from someone on day 1?

One of the most influential profs ever! He knows his stuff back and forth, and he knows how to teach it such that you always will remember the important concepts.  Sure, he was slightly arrogant, but he was also one of the most intellectual persons I have ever known.  His class was fun because it was so applicable.  There are tutors to help, too.

No talking allowed in lecture. No office hours. Questions are very rare. Not too helpful. Will not field questions after lecture... tells you to save it until the day before the midterm when there is a review day in lecture. No questions allowed during midterms or final exam. All multiple choice questions.
Okay class, probably more fun if you have an interest in econ.  Had some great insights, just was very unhelpful and was at the point where he needed to leave the system.  And he did.

Marv has great insight on the subject of economics and can answer any question without bias and hesitation...unless its about Nixon. He provides past exams that are a great preparation tool.  There are a few exam questions that are subtle in lecture.  Pay attention, no talking, just absorb knowledge.
If you are an insecure person, don't take him. Easy as that. For everyone else, it was an easy class and Marv will make you laugh at times. He might be retiring though.

This guy was ridiculous! Very rude and not helpful whatsoever. Went off on tangents during lectures and chewed out people who had different opinions. Makes you feel stupid for being confused. Easy class but extremely boring and useless. I don't recommend.

He was rather unconventional but that helped me learn it better than just readying a textbook.  His real-world examples were also very useful.  Go to tutors if want to do well.  Tests all multiple choice.

Easiest class ever. I didn't even have to study for the final. Go to the lectures and you will have no problem in this class and you get points for going. DON'T buy the textbook! I didn't buy it, and you won't need it. Marv is arrogant and offends a lot of people. He is a good prof though.

Theres no textbook. you have to go see tutors if you want answers to the problem sets, but they dont get an answer key to the problems, so theres no right answer. Never ask a question in class, you'll be embarrassed in front of the entire lecture.

This guy is ridiculous.  Very arrogant, don't bother going to office hours, he'll simply to tell you to ask questions in class - seriously, completely useless.  He makes fun of a lot of kids, which is hilarious as long as you're not under the crosshairs. The class isn't hard if you study the material thoroughly, attend class, and do all practice ma

Great class! He's a funny, sarcastic guy but he's got some points. The key to success in this class is to attend lectures, go to the tutors, do the problem sets and practice exams and you'll be fine. One final note, don't buy the book. It's a waste of money and you won't use it in class.

Personally, I really liked him. He's very sarcastic so be warned. He takes attendence so make sure to attend lecture plus you should anyway since that's the best way to understand the material. Do not buy the book! If anything get a very old edition because it won't help you. Do the problem sets he emails and go to the tutors. You can do well.

Go to lecture, and get into a study group to do problem sets and practice exams.  He's a funny guy. Definitely keeps you awake and is a good story teller.  He gives good examples of economics in real life, and makes you think economically. He is a bit arrogant, but he is a good professor.  Don't ask the types of questions he told you not to ask.

His lectures sometimes left me confused but I still like him. He generalizes quite a lot of information which makes it easy for my studying. Just see the tutors and do the past year paper and you'll do fine

In order to do well you have to attend lecture.  He won't answer questions at office hours about lecture material and doesn't really go over things twice.  Instead he tells you to see a tutor.  This class will either click or not click and thats how you pass the class.  If you understand the material you should pass.
He makes the power lecture go by really fast and is a good story teller.  He is also arrogant and his class is poorly constructed. I didn't learn a lot from him about economics.

arrogent. wears same pants everyday. goes off on random, confusing tangents. makes up his own words so the book is a waste of money. he gives practice exams, but refuses to give answer sheet or tell you answers. allows you to ask questions about exam, but only if they are "thinking" questions. he needs to get over himself. TAKE MICRO.

I took this class because I need econ for my major. I'd taken econ in HS. At first I, like most of the class, liked Marv. Then slowly there were signs that he wasn't the "cool, involved, organic" professor he tries to seem to be. Marv is unbelievibly arrogant. I've never met a more arrogant person in my life, and the class is terribly set up.

I have never taken a class where the professor expects you to learn from other students.  The fact that he refuses to work out problems involving any math is an indication that he probably doesn't even know how and has relied on memerization of material for years without knowing how to actually work out the problems.  cannot answer simple questions

His stories are fun and interesting, but the marginal benefits to the university would certainly outweigh the marginal costs if they simply hired the tutors this professor recruits to teach the course full time. If he didn't take attendance I would go to the tutors when I needed and show up only for the tests.
Marv is awesome!  He makes the lectures so fun.  I've learned more from his crazy stories alone than any other class lectures.

This class was very easy for me but I have a good econ mind. It's easier than econ 101 and theres only a week of ag. stuff so its not bad.  it also touches on macro which is good if you want to take econ 102 after. theres no sections but there are several tutor that i heard are all good and very helpful.  marv is eccentric which is nice for achange

Yeah, he's arrognt but thats what makes the class interesting. His class seems like an act that he has done for years so he can answer questions in the most eloquent and amusing way. Unfortunately, it is not always the clearest or answer you want. Just go to the tutors and do the practice exams. They are very helpful. Its more econ than ag. Not bad

Arrogant, thinks it's fun to suck off the government system.  is proud that he will die thousands and thousands of dollars in debt.  makes up words, TA's can't help you, the book can't help you and even your friend sitting in class can't help!

Marv really knows his econ, he does make up his own terms but he really explains them well. Don't even bother with any of the problem sets, just do the practice exams and you're golden. The provided tutors are very helpful. Fun class, I'd def. take it again.
yes, he is def a lil arrogant, but the class isn't that bad, if you need an econ take it

go to lectures and listen to the ambiguous terms that he creates because they will be on exams...go to the tutors for the answers to the practice tests and there's no reason why you can't receive an a in this class
He made the class interesting and had a good approach to teaching.
No Comments
i got F for the second midterm but got AB for final grade. Don't expect him to explain things clearly, just do past exams. This way helped me a lot.

He seemed like a really cool prof in the beggining. But as the semester has passed...im starting to see that he is really VERY arrogant.  He makes you think the way he is teaching is easy, when infact the book explains it in a much easier way. He is between 5-10 mins late to class EVERYDAY, and yet he yells at peeps if they are late or leave early

Easy, easy class - do your homework, go to the interesting lectures, don't even bother with the problem sets, just do the practice tests and go to the tutors for the answers - stuff is almost word for word on the actual test.  Take this class over economics, any day.

Even though this professor makes up his own terms, he explains them well. His problem sets are confusing and he usually forgets to bring something to class. He gives out practice exams but they aren't accompanied by answer keys, you have to get help to answer some questions. Sometimes, the tutors don't even know what the questions's asking about...

He sucked at teaching, and I'm sure he won't change his teaching style. You should go to every lecture, and take note because he uses his own created words that nobody could explain it for you but he. He gives us problem sets every week and practice exam for tests, but he never ever give us answers.

He makes economics interesting which is nice if you have no previous interest in or knowledge about econ.  It's really not a hard class, but you do need to go to class and take decent notes.  The provided tutors are also very helpful.

Awesome prof. His stories make economics real. Made the class really fun. Will make people on both the left and right think hard about the issues. Best class so far. Just do the homework, practice exams and meet with the tutors and you'll be fine.
The guy apparently knows every high-ranking government official of the last 40 years...he was interesting though.

horrible teacher, makes up his own terminology, so you can't get help from anyone who didn't have him for econ, irrelavent stories that don't aid in understanding, most arrogant, self-involved person i've ever met

Funniest teacher ever. Loves to pick on people if they say something stupid. Very interesting. I you know your econ. you will do really good if you don't you won't. "Keep your grasp of the obvious strong" Review material and you will do good.

nice guy...funny...but terrible teacher! his classes have no structure but they are fun to watch. if you're into professors who love themselves more than an actual textbook...he is your man! but he is very entertaining!
he's a really fun guy =) just that he speaks too fast

Makes lectures interesting and throws in 15 min. of open discussion at the end of every one.  His exams were worded very unclear and sometimes did not seem to represent how much you actually knew about econ.  He is pretty funny in class, I would recommend
The best econ teacher ever.  He made the material so easy to understand and the tests are not that bad.

Phenomenal teacher, with a humor like Jack Nicholson.  Watch out for flying chalk if you're thinking about not paying attention!  Great stories that really represent the topic.  Put it this way: Thought I would hate econ with a passion, but it's alright!
Fun guy, likes to pick on the annoying people, which is good. Total ****, makes the stuff interesting.
Hilarious, fresh, clear, down to earth

i just did not like this guy's teaching style...everyone was so hooked when he lit a cigarette (as a joke) in the first class, people thought he was the  coolest  person on earth...nice guy, but a shaky prof...i heard his AAE 215 classes are way better...
No Comments
Hilarious-- likes to throw chalk
good at getting class involved in lecture
Dynamic lecturer.
made me love econ
No Comments
